Experience Technical Project Lead and Senior Software Engineer DMI (Digital Management, Inc.) January 2014  –  December 2014  (1 year) Hillsboro, OR Technical Project Lead, Architect and a Senior Software Engineer of an Android Mobile Security project, leading a team to harden open-source Android PDF reader app (MuPDF) with security features provided by pre-released Intel CPU (Software Guard Extensions)and SDK (Software Development Kit) to be delivered to USAFA and other US Government agencies for evaluation. 
 
-	Ported MuPDF into SGX SDK build environment and created the first SGX secure enclave to process secrets at run-time 
-	Designed, implemented and tested AndroidUbuntu Linux network communication protocol for use by the team to extract and deliver secrets from Android Tablet to Ubuntu Server for processing 
-	Refactored MuPDF into trusted and untrusted code bases to parse PDF files inside an SGX secure enclave so that all PDF processing is encrypted 
-	Created and tracking team’s schedule to ensure all functionality is implemented and delivered on or ahead of schedule 
-	Interfacing with SGX SDK team on a regular basis to discuss solutions and report occasional SGX SDK bugs 
-	Designed, implemented and tested security features such as One-Time Password and Permanent Password with server authentication and re-login support 
-	Designed, implemented and tested client provisioning and attestation and session setup with the server utilizing SGX SDK APIs and samples Software Development Team and Technical Lead Intel January 2010  –  July 2013  (3 years 7 months) Hillsboro, OR Team and Technical Lead of all Server Simulation projects used company-wide by various firmware and software teams such as BIOS, OS, Validation and Marketing for pre-silicon development and testing. 
 
In addition to Senior Software Development Responsibilities (below), 
 
Turned an under-performing simulation tool into a tool of choice for its first tier users by providing more features than any other competitor tool and adding to the existing features’ depth and breadth; tool’s usage acquired several secondary tier users purely through the word-of-mouth advertising; each consequent project’s longevity extended into new usage scenarios and considerably surpassed its predecessor as far as available functionality. 
 
Delivered a generational improvement over what was planned and with a very small team by mentoring and coaching junior and new team members about Server Simulation features and functionality, and end-user priorities and requirements.  
 
Trained junior engineers to assume ownership of various features, such as 
- Intel QuickPath Interconnect (QPI) initialization, register support, and 8-socket configurations. 
- Register definition and various package updates such as core product, BIOS, and OS to make sure only the latest was in use.  
- Core product fixes integration into Server Simulation releases. 
 
Created and delivered training presentations, such as 
- Overview of Server Simulation features, team’s Product Life Cycle (PLC), and engaging with the team, which resulted in a (1) tremendous increase in end-user involvement at the requirements gathering phase, overall elevated end-user expectations of the end-product; new user bases; and (2) provided better insight to the core product team on Server Simulation projects 
- Overview of BIOS and hardware early power-on and reset algorithms to educate team members and core product team on the design changes required in the next generation core product. Senior Software Development Engineer Intel Corporation April 2008  –  July 2013  (5 years 4 months) Hillsboro, OR In addition to Software Development Engineer responsibilities (below),  
 
Designed, implemented, tested and maintained various hardware models, such as 
- Architecture to model several server platforms within the same simulation release; guided the team to update all server models per new architecture.  
- Intel QuickPath Interconnect (QPI) and Integrated Memory Controller (iMC) models to support both Efficient Performance (EP) and Expandable (EX) server segments by capitalizing on common functionality and separating generic and architecture-specific features. Added support for various QPI modes and boot in single- and multi-socket configurations. 
 
Regularly distributed features and sightings load among all team members. 
 
Created an early adopters program to solicit end-user’s feedback starting with the first engineering release, while only a subset of simulation models were ready for deployment. 
Pioneered frequent, but feature-rich and high quality releases to enable consistent end-user involvement and feedback. 
Led release creation automation including check-out, build, release notes, packaging, release posting and error reporting on every engineering check-in, which also allowed for frequent release updates for the end-users. 
Led a contractor to implement a Proof of Concept (PoC) to automate BIOS and Server Simulation release testing as one package. Simulator-tested PoC was ready to be deployed on real hardware. 
 
Identified gaps, provided feedback on prospective solutions and verified final solutions fully addressed issues in 
- Various hardware specifications and register definitions collateral, delivered by other teams and critical to enable team’s early project engagement.  
- Core product features, such as x86 hardware reset types, multi-thread and multi-core support. Reset fixes to various core product models enabled, for the first time, BIOS pre-silicon reset flows testing in both single- and multi-socket topologies. Software Development Engineer Intel Corporation June 2006  –  April 2008  (1 year 11 months) Chandler, AZ Designed, implemented, tested and maintained modeling the execution of various firmware where executing firmware itself was not feasible. Assessed which firmware features were required for a successful BIOS boot such that it was enough to implement only a subset of a given firmware. 
 
Attended a two-week training session (in Russian) in Moscow, Russia to gain understanding of the core simulation base product and establish a good working relationship with the core product team. 
 
Researched and collected various training material to regularly bring the team up-to-speed. 
 
Identified gaps, provided feedback on prospective solutions and verified final solutions fully resolved gaps in the sightings and features delivered by the core product team. Chaired weekly meetings to discuss status, ensure timely and complete solutions were provided, and resolve roadblocks. 
 
Coordinated the efforts of various teams in order to deliver external Server Simulation releases. Worked with core product, marketing, and BIOS teams all over the globe to ensure releases were free of Intel Intellectual Property (IP) and booted all Plan On Record (POR) topologies. 
 
Enabled boot of various firmware unmodified on Server Simulations by identifying and then implementing all required features. 
 
Ensured all sightings were addressed promptly and optimally prioritized for Server Simulation needs by leading and mentoring dotted-line engineers from the core product team located in another geo and part of a different department. Influenced the quality of features ported to the next generation core product. Firmware and Embedded Software Engineer Intel Corporation May 2000  –  June 2006  (6 years 2 months) Chandler, AZ HARDENING 
- Designed, implemented and tested hardening of various features of Chassis Management Module (CMM) firmware. Algorithms included data integrity and reliability of Data Synchronization phase, Intelligent Platform Management Interface (IPMI) Management Bus (IMB) error reporting and IPMI Action Scripts backup. Algorithms were reviewed and approved with very few suggestions by external customers. 
 
INVESTIGATIONS 
- Researched and documented approaches, efforts, capabilities and roadblocks to porting client segment features such as Third Party Data Storage (3PDS) into server segment. Established good working relationship with client segment teams in the process.

- Designed, implemented, and tested C Linux character drivers to demonstrate various technologies at a Proof of Concept level. •	Web server development work with Node.js, Jade, JavaScript, MongoDB and MySQL, including tools development. 
 Software Development Engineer Revolution Analytics April 2014  –  July 2014  (4 months) Seattle, WA Software development for R statistical programming platform 
 
•	Analyzed and resolved bugs in core product RevoScaleR (C++, R). 
•	Performed development activities to ensure company’s core product, RevoScaleR could run successfully on a new Hadoop platform (MapR). Developed automated procedures and scripts (Bash, Ruby, Perl) for nightly regression testing. 
•	Developed installation scripts and procedures for customers to easily install both MapR and RevoScaleR on multi-node Linux clusters, including Amazon AWS EC2 clusters. 
 Software Development Engineer Intel Corporation (via contract) April 2013  –  March 2014  (1 year) Hillsboro, OR Software development for Intel Technical Computing Group and Intel Education Services. 
 
•	Designed and developed a REST-style web request handler and a web client in C++ from a PHP prototype. Integrated PostgreSQL database as a back end. Visual Studio development environment. This component was responsible authenticate users and securely deliver content in an insecure environment. 
•	Developed and enhanced monitoring and control software for Intel's Xeon Knights Corner and Knights Landing high-performance computing platform (Linux, C, C++, Python, Perl). 
•	Developed automation scripts for configuring OS and installing software on clean linux builds. 
•	Researched and tested open source software packages for possible use in custom cluster management solutions. Software Development Engineer Meteorcomm (via contract) August 2012  –  December 2012  (5 months) Renton, WA C++, Python, Ruby software development for the national Interoperable Train Control Message system. 
 
•	Designed and developed an automated diagnostic messaging and reporting feature for this advanced buffered network communication system. (C++, Boost). 
•	Augmented the system deployment tool with enhanced diagnostic reporting on component run status (Ruby). 
•	Designed and developed system management commands to request, receive, and process diagnostic messages from any local or remotely connected communications endpoint on the system (C++, Python). 
•	Assisted in set up of our team's development tools including Git Server, Jenkins continuous integration server, Redmine defect tracking system, and Pivotal Tracker agile project management tool. Created a version control project for the teams' locally created script tools under Git. Product Support Engineer Avaya January 2009  –  June 2012  (3 years 6 months) Bellevue WA Analysis and troubleshooting of critical software escalations for Avaya's Proactive Contact outbound dialing system, as well as for their TSAPI Application Enablement Services (AES) system. Avaya business telephony solutions are used by many large corporations in mission critical applications. 
 
•	Returned to Avaya for a third time as a senior consulting software engineer. 
•	Investigated and resolved Avaya's most challenging critical software problems (C++, Perl, JAVA, HP-UX, Linux) with their Proactive Contact Dialer and AES systems at customer sites around the world. 
•	Investigated and resolved TSAPI communication protocol problems between Avaya Aura Communication Manager and third party vendor applications such as Nice Systems, Verint, and Microsoft Office Communicator. 
•	Designed and developed several system diagnostic tools (Perl) for the product engineering team. 
•	Key developer and contributor in 4 successive product development cycles encompassing over a dozen major new product features and 2 million lines of C++ code running on HP/UX and Linux.
